I'm afraid I can no longer accept your orders. You are an enemy of my lord the Doctor.
I am your lord! I built you! Release me, I command you. And launch instantly!
Do you know the Doctor well? He is a wonderful man. He has done the most extraordinary things to my circuitry.
Release me!
Truly wonderful. If you like, I will tell you all about him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Skagra sinks to his knees in despair.

Dialogue.Line: Let me out! Let me out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Wilkin and a police constable walk slowly though the college.

Dialogue.Line: Stolen a room?
That is the only way I can describe it.

Well, you see, sir, in my experience people don't usually steal rooms very much. They may steal from rooms, but steal the rooms themselves? Very rarely. In fact I think, er, never is probably the word I'm looking for here, sir. I mean, where's the advantage in it? Not much of a black market in rooms, is there? Wouldn't get much for it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They go through to the next courtyard.

Dialogue.Line: I know it's very difficult to understand. It's also very easy to be sarcastic.
Sarcastic, sir? I don't know the word. Now why don't you run over the salient points again?
Oh. Well, I got to the door of the room and I opened it, and beyond it there was nothing.
Nothing at all, sir?
Absolutely nothing at all. Well, nothing except for this sort of blue haze.
Ah, well, the blue haze, you see, sir, may be the vital clue we're searching for.
And I was not drinking.
So this is the famous door, is it sir?
Yes.
Behind which you saw your er, blue haze?
Yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Constable knocks on the door.

Dialogue.Line: Come in!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The constable opens the door to reveal a coat on a peg beyond, and the rest of the rooms.

Dialogue.Line: Well, whoever took it, sir, seems to have brought it back, don't they.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Chronotis is serving tea to the Doctor, Romana, Clare and Parsons as Wilkin and the Constable enter. The Doctor is reading out loud from The Old Curiosity Shop by Charles Dickens. Chapter 71, if you're interested. Or is he?

Dialogue.Line: Her little homely dress, her favourite, cried the old man, pressing it to his breast and patting it with his shrivelled hand. She'll miss it when she wakes.
Hello? Can I help you?
Routine inquiry, sir. Report that this room has been stolen.
Huh!
Stolen? I don't think so, officer. (to Parsons) Ah, here you are. Cup of tea and some aspirin.
Thank you, Professor.
Aspirin, sir?
Yes, headache.
Bad night last night, sir?
Yes, you could say that.
A lot of celebrating going on in college, was there, sir, last night?
Nothing out of the ordinary.
Be normal high jinks that would be then, sir, would it? Students roaming the streets stealing policeman's helmets, bollards, and

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The constable spots a blue police telephone box parked in the corner.

Dialogue.Line: Might I ask where you got that, sir?
Yes, it's mine.
Oh, really, sir?
Yes, really. Come on, Romana. Bye, Wilkin, Bristol, Keightley. Goodbye, Professor, we'll keep your secret.
Bye everybody.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Romana enter the Tardis with the book.

Dialogue.Line: Bye!
Secret, sir? And what secret would that be?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Tardis dematerialises.

Dialogue.Line: Cup of tea?
Where did that police box go?
What police box that would be, officer?
Right. Right. Coats on, everyone. You're all taking a little walk with me down to the Bridewell.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: New live action scene. The Doctor is working under one side of the console, and K9 on the other. Romana is supposed to be in an inner room or corridor, because Lalla won't work directly with Tom.

Dialogue.Line: Where was Skagra from, anyway?
K9's metabolic analysis says he was from the planet Dronid. Remember your Time Lord history?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Whatever K9 was doing makes the console go bang!

Dialogue.Line: Oh! There was a schism in the College of the Cardinals. The rival President set up shop of Dronid. They forced him to come back by totally ignoring him. (Laughs then stands, but we only see his hands on the console.)
It seems hard to believe the Professor was the great Salyavin. He's such a nice old man. I wonder if the stories of Salyavin were exaggerated?

(the elderly Tom Baker.) More than likely. The Time Lords over-react to everything. Look at the way they treat me. I expect at some time in the future, about two hundred years time, someone will meet me and say, is that really the Doctor? He seemed such a nice old man.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Laughs directly to camera.
